image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: DNA evidence could make or break Melbourneâ€™s Easey Street cold case, a court has heard, with the main suspect denying any involvement in the double murder.

title.children: DNA from 1977 murder scene likely came from prime suspect, court hears

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints

image.altText: A view from under a large, leafy green tree.

props.synopsis: Residents of a small Victorian town hope a Tree of the Year award will save a beloved Algerian oak from being chopped down to make way for transmission lines.

title.children: Victoria's Tree of the Year threatened by the Western Renewables Link

image.altText: A woman smiling and taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: In a rarely-seen move, a Victorian judge halts proceedings in the Supreme Court to hold a minute's silence for a domestic violence murder victim.

title.children: Lachlan Young stares blankly during minute's silence for Hannah McGuire

image.altText: Georgie Cleaver of the Eagles competes with Giselle Davies of the Swans.

props.synopsis: The final round of the AFLW home and away season promises to be nervous watching for more than half the competition's fans as eleven sides battle for seven finals spots up for grabs.

title.children: 'Most that's been on the line for many clubs': AFLW heads into final round

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: Victorian authorities have received almost 1,000 reports of alleged abuse and misconduct against early childhood educators in the past year, according to a new watchdog report.

title.children: Shocking scale of childcare abuse allegations laid bare in new report

image.altText: An umpire throws the ball in

props.synopsis: The AFL confirms the arrival of the last disposal rule as one of seven rule changes aimed at making umpires' jobs easier while shortening the length of games.

title.children: Last disposal rule headlines AFL's seven changes for 2026 season

image.altText: Dry farmland beneath a mostly clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Federation of Victorian Traditional Owner Corporations calls for a pause on mining approvals until a formal benefit-sharing agreement is in place.

title.children: Traditional owner group calls for a pause on Victorian mining approvals

image.altText: A wombat.

props.synopsis: Conservationists say wombats on Victoria's Bass Coast are under threat from off-leash dogs that have been spotted entering their coastal burrows.

title.children: Fears wombats are under threat from dogs on Victoria's Bass Coast

image.altText: Birds eye view of Lake Boga.

props.synopsis: Blue-green algae levels at Lake Boga in Victoria's north-west are three times the safe limit.

title.children: Fears high algae levels will make Victorian lake off limits this summer

image.altText: A man in a suit outside of a court house.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Magistrate says he has not been convinced that Thomas Sewell's behaviour during a 2023 Neo-Nazi rally in Ballarat was offensive.

title.children: Thomas Sewell found not guilty of offensive behaviour by Victorian court

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: A render of the west gate tunnel entrance showing a ventilation structure.

props.synopsis: Victoria's emergency services are unprepared for critical incidents in Melbourne's soon-to-be-opened West Gate Tunnel, senior firefighters warn.

title.children: Top firefighters say West Gate Tunnel not safe until checks completed

image.altText: A mosaic of close-ups of faces, mostly eyes and some mouths. The faces are black and white.

props.synopsis: The true scale of abuse in Australia's childcare centres has been hidden. With 200,000 pages of previously confidential files, police tip-offs, and evidence from whistleblowers, Four Corners exposes the reality.

title.children: 'These monsters are thriving': Paedophiles have infiltrated childcare centres

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A man arrested for allegedly holding a placard depicting suspected police killer Dezi Freeman at an anti-immigration rally in Adelaide will be formally cautioned, SA Police say.

title.children: Man to be cautioned over Dezi Freeman placard at anti-immigration rally

image.altText: Photo shows the outside of the Malmsbury Youth Justice facility.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is reopening the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre less than two years after closing the facility, which was plagued by riots and escape attempts.

title.children: Troubled Malmsbury youth justice centre to reopen

image.altText: smoke rising from the ground at a tip, there are trucks working on the site nearby.

props.synopsis: A company responsible for a tip that has been on fire for nearly six years may be allowed to keep its landfill licence, the ABC can reveal.Â

title.children: EPA may restore licence for Melbourne west tip burning six years

image.altText: A smiling man and woman, both with dark hair and dressed in Australian sports uniforms, on an ice rink.

props.synopsis: Despite being set to take the world number one mixed-doubles ranking, Australian curling duo Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt still face a major challenge in booking their spot at their second Winter Olympics.

title.children: Aussie curlers face tough Olympic qualification despite purple patch

image.altText: A Sydney Swans AFLW player holds the ball in both hands as she looks away to sense if defenders are near.

props.synopsis: Sydney will be without co-captain Chloe Molloy for the rest of the AFLW season in a major setback as their finals hopes hang in the balance.

title.children: Back surgery ends AFLW season for Swans star Molloy

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: In a week of wild weather across the country, the Bureau of Meteorology's new website missed the mark.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology defends unpopular new weather website

image.altText: A CCTV image of a car going through a pedestrian crossing near several people.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police releases vision of a car which sped through a pedestrian crossing in Melbourne's south-east, narrowly missing a number of pedestrians.Â

title.children: Police search for driver after terrifying pedestrian near miss

image.altText: Man in the snow wearing beanie and snow goggles around his neck.

props.synopsis: The family of a man who was on a small boat that capsized on Friday night say they are mourning the loss of their uncle, brother and friend, as police scale back their search.

title.children: Family mourns loss of man missing in waters off Melbourne

image.altText: A tree fallen on a fence.

props.synopsis: Some residents have recounted seeing family members lifted off their feet as what the Bureau of Meteorology believes was a tornado swept through Melbourne's western suburbs on Sunday.

title.children: 'Like stuff out of a movie': Tornado believed to have hit Melbourne's west

image.altText: ski patrol volunteer amid heavy snow.

props.synopsis: A volunteer ski patrol captain raises concerns for public safety as part of measures to cut costs at Victoria's Mount Stirling Alpine Resort, which has operated at a deficit for years.Â

title.children: Ski patrol sounds alarm over public safety if cuts made at Mt Stirling

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Photos and videos shown to a Victorian court capture a racially charged speech given by Thomas Sewell before he leads a group of 30 masked men through Ballarat.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell claims Ballarat rally was political

image.altText: View over paramedic Jack's shoulder as Sissy Austin smiles at her home

props.synopsis: When Sissy Austin, a young Aboriginal woman, was left dizzied and bloodied by an unprovoked assault while running, a small gesture from an attending paramedic helped her feel safe.

title.children: After a violent assault, this small act helped Sissy feel safe

image.altText: The Kangaroos run out onto the field.

props.synopsis: While some suggest that this year's AFLW premiers being all but known has caused some to lose interest, commentators say North Melbourne's dominance is inspirational.

title.children: Watching North Melbourne's dominance 'a privilege not a punishment'

image.altText: peg stands against brick wall holding her phone

props.synopsis: Data from the latest HILDA survey indicate socialising rates have dropped over the past two decades, and, more recently, have not returned to pre-COVID frequency.

title.children: We are socialising less and loneliness is rising. Here is what can help

image.altText: A close-up image of a hand holding a branch of pale white flowers, still attached to the tree.

props.synopsis: Farmers and distillers collaborate to capture a delicate flower's flavour for the boutique drinks market.

title.children: Father-son team's hand-picked citrus blossoms brighten cocktails

image.altText: two police cars with lihts on parked in a street with police tape around

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a suspected machete brawl after a 19-year-old man was found with serious injuries.Â

title.children: Man seriously injured in suspected machete brawl in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A dark brown butterfly with yellow, blue and tan markings.

props.synopsis: Australia's photographic natural database is about to get a big boost as citizen scientists are urged to join a national search.

title.children: Bug Hunt calls on Australia's volunteer citizen scientists to join in

image.altText: A boy standing over his trainset.

props.synopsis: In the main room of a local pub in the western Victorian town of Natimuk, Brock Mewett shows off his toy trains to raise money for the Royal Children's Hospital.

title.children: 10yo boy holds toy train exhibition to raise funds for sick children

image.altText: Rebecca in a cave wearing a helmet and holding dynamite

props.synopsis: The mining industry is notoriously "bloke-centred". Rebecca Norton transitioned gender and kept going.

title.children: 50 years ago, a transgender mining engineer broke the glass ceiling

image.altText: Jason Sourasis and Scott Pendlebury.

props.synopsis: Former Magpies skipper Scott Pendlebury has hired one of Australia's most high-profile commercial lawyers to claim millions that he alleges his former confidant misappropriated.

title.children: How a billion-dollar dream blew up a friendship with an AFL star

image.altText: An underwater scene, showing sea urchins sitting on coral and algae species.

props.synopsis: A hidden environmental crisis lurks beneath the crystal clear waters of Australia's east coast as long-spined sea urchins wreak havoc on the coast. Now scientists are trialling a new solution.

title.children: AI robots to stop sea urchins turning seabed into 'moonscape'
